DataElement.preferredName: SF-36v2 Health Survey  Past 4 Weeks How Much Physical Health Or Emotional Problems Interfere With Normal Social Activities Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of the extent that their physical health or emotional problems has interferred with their normal social activities with family, friends, neighbors, or groups, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard US Version 2.0 Questionnaire Past 4 Weeks How Much of the Time Physical Well-being Problem Or Emotional Problem Interference With Normal Socializing Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized, multipurpose, general health survey developed by John E. Ware and copyrighted by Quality Metric Inc. and the Medical Outcomes Trust in 1996 and 2000 which is used to assess the patient's functional health and overall well-being. This second version contains 36 questions that refer to the patient's symptoms or status within the past four weeks and can be completed by the patient. For each question the patient must choose from five different responses._A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present._A question about how much of the time something is occurring or has occurred._The general condition of one's body._A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A perceived issue with a person's emotional wellbeing._The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm._Interactions with one or more individuals, usually with a common purpose or with regards to a common topic of interest._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized, multipurpose, general health survey developed by John E. Ware and copyrighted by Quality Metric Inc. and the Medical Outcomes Trust in 1996 and 2000 which is used to assess the patient's functional health and overall well-being. This second version contains 36 questions that refer to the patient's symptoms or status within the past four weeks and can be completed by the patient. For each question the patient must choose from five different responses.

Concepts.longName: Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized, multipurpose, general health survey developed by John E. Ware and copyrighted by Quality Metric Inc. and the Medical Outcomes Trust in 1996 and 2000 which is used to assess the patient's functional health and overall well-being. This second version contains 36 questions that refer to the patient's symptoms or status within the past four weeks and can be completed by the patient. For each question the patient must choose from five different responses.

Property.preferredName: Past 4 Weeks How Much of the Time Physical Well-being Problem Or Emotional Problem Interference With Normal Socializing Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present.:A question about how much of the time something is occurring or has occurred.:The general condition of one's body.:A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A perceived issue with a person's emotional wellbeing.:The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.:Interactions with one or more individuals, usually with a common purpose or with regards to a common topic of interest.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present.
A question about how much of the time something is occurring or has occurred.
The general condition of one's body.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A perceived issue with a person's emotional wellbeing.
The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
Interactions with one or more individuals, usually with a common purpose or with regards to a common topic of interest.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: SF-36v2:Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire, Sherbourne Cathy D; Ware John E., 1998
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Alliance study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 4/24/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A Likert scale that captures the score of the extent of interference from 1 (not at all) to 5 (extremely).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Small or little in size, quantity, or degree.

Concepts.definition: Small or little in size, quantity, or degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match NCIt. mc 9/8/20

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: SF-36v2:Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire, Sherbourne Cathy D; Ware John E., 1998
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for Alliance study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 4/24/14

ReferenceDocuments.name: During the past 4 weeks, to w
ReferenceDocuments.description: During the past 4 weeks, to what extent has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your normal social activities with family, friends, neighbors, or groups?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: During the past 4 weeks, how much of the time has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your social activities (like visiting friends, relatives, etc.)?
